author: J14T14
title: â€œNo capes!"
review:
Finally, we get an Edna Mode minifigure that is available to everyone at a fair price and that everyone can obtain! I have been wanting this figure to help complete my Incredibles collection (I only need the original 30615-1 Edna Mode and 71012-14 Syndrome).

While the original Edna was based off or her appearance in the first Incredibles movie, this one is based off of her look in the Incredibles 2. Her torso is a new print and looks great when compared to the movie. The original Edna also had her classes printed on and reused a common hair piece. This Edna uses a completely new hairpiece that also has the glasses molded in and the eyes printed on. This looks a lot better than the original, but it can be a little off putting at some angles. Her head has new prints with a normal-ish face underneath. I say normal-ish because it has normal minifigure proportions, but it is so different with the glasses on that is is just a little shocking. She also has the short legs in black, which works perfectly considering her height. Her accessories are a tea cup and a bag that has a 1x2 print on it with her business logo on it.

Overall, I think that you should get this minifigure. If you are a Disney fan, pick it up! If you want some new pieces to make some mocs with, pick it up! it is a fantastic minifigure and everyone should try to get one!

author: freakymedusa050
title: LOVE IT!
review:
I always wanted to own this minifigure. The new Lego Disney Minifigure series gave me the chance to buy it. 

Edna Mode reminds me of the world of fashion, to Anna Wintour. 


The figure itself looks perfect and accurate. Her long-sleeved T-shirt is so sophisticated and stylish. The hairpiece is fantastic, it looks great on the figure. I have only one problem with the hairpiece, it looks strange from an upper point of view because the glasses hide her mouth. 
It has two accessories, a cup, and an Edna Mode bag. I have to say, I love that bag, it is so chic. It is from the Incredibles 2. 


All in all, I absolutely love this minifigure, if you are a Disney fan you should get this one!

author: Odeinoichus
title: NO CAPES! Is a tad cliche for a title, but what else can I say?
review:
Set #71024 Edna Mode: Our favourite diminutive character from Incredibles not part of the Parr family has had some pretty strange releases. First there was a polybag with the game, and then the CMF for Disney Series 2.

I feel the CMF captures the likeness better and shows the character with more interesting details. Her torso has a very solid print for her top and her short legs are a solid black. She carries a tea cup in one hand and a copy of a magazine with her name on the cover used with a 1x2 with bar on the end and a 1x2 printed tile. Her head features a large smiling expression and a dour frowning expression. Her hair piece is quite unique, she is only the third Minifigure I am aware of that incorporates glasses into the hair sculpt to cover the eyes. (The other two being Crazy Scientist from Series 14 and Robin from The LEGO Batman Movie.)

This hair piece also has a hole in the top which is sized to accommodate LEGO Friends accessories. A tad odd that, but I suppose it adds to the versatility. Overall Edna is a very impressive Minifigure and definitely worth tracking down if you want to add her character to the LEGO Incredibles collection. Recommended.
